== Lubuntu Community ==
Lubuntu's Community consist of two main groups: '''Users''' and '''Official Members'''.

* Lubuntu Users: Newcomers, Beginners, Average, or Advanced Users, all of those belong to Lubuntu Users Group. You simply become a Lubuntu User when you download, install Lubuntu and start using it. Users may spread the word of Lubuntu, support each other with technical support questions/requests, report bugs, send feedback, suggest some features, have some activities, etc but they don't actually contribute directly to Lubuntu with a direct participation.

* Lubuntu Official Members: Beside they are Users of Lubuntu, the official members are those who are '''actively''' and '''directly''' contribute and participate to Lubuntu. There are <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Lubuntu/SubTeams | many areas where those members are involved]]</nowiki>. They are decision makers when it comes to Lubuntu, simply because they do know Lubuntu more than others and know what is the best for Lubuntu and the whole community but of course, they are friendly, helpful and listen to the users' feedback. Also, the official members '''must''' complete <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Lubuntu/GettingInvolved#Lubuntu_Official_Members | these steps]]</nowiki> before they be considered as members while this is not required by the users of Lubuntu. 

This page will list the names of Lubuntu Community so that you can get to know those who are behind Lubuntu :)
